title: Arc length formula
text: Arc Length can be found by computing $$\int_{a}^{b} \sqrt{1+{\operatorname{f'}\left(x\right)}^2} \,dx$$, f'(x) is derivative of f(x) and interval [a,b]
speech: Arc Length can be found by computing  the integral from a to b of the square root of 1 plus f prime, of x squared end root d x , f'(x) is derivative of f(x) and interval [a,b]

, f'(x) is derivative of f(x) and interval [a,b]

title: Find the interval
text: We need to find the interval on x-axis, which is [0,1]

title: Plug in
text: After we plug f'(x) and interval, we will have Arc $$Length=\int_{0}^{1} \sqrt{1+{\left(\frac{3}{2} x^{\frac{1}{2}}\right)}^2} \,dx=\int_{0}^{1} \sqrt{1+\frac{9}{4} x} \,dx$$
